lines.content: This project now includes a JavaFX GUI implementation for the Rei chatbot.
- Added JavaFX controls and FXML dependencies to `build.gradle.kts`
- Added JavaFX application plugin for proper module handling
- Created a separate launcher class to avoid JavaFX module issues
- This is the main entry point that launches the GUI application
- Main JavaFX Application class with chat interface
- Features a scrollable chat area, text input field, and send button
- Integrates with existing command parsing and execution system
- Automatically scrolls to show latest messages
- Custom GUI component for displaying chat messages
- Visually distinguishes user messages (blue) from bot messages (green)
- Styled with rounded corners and appropriate spacing
- Implements the same interface as console UI but collects responses
- Allows commands to work seamlessly with GUI without modification
- Created common interface for both console and GUI UI implementations
- Updated all command classes to use this interface
- Enables polymorphic usage of different UI types
- Clean, modern styling for the chat interface
- Blue theme for user messages, green for bot responses
- Proper button and text field styling
1. **Chat Interface**: Type commands and see responses in a conversational format
2. **Command Support**: All existing commands work (todo, deadline, event, list, find, delete, mark, unmark, bye)
3. **Visual Feedback**: Clear distinction between user input and bot responses
5. **Keyboard Support**: Press Enter to send commands
6. **Responsive Design**: Window can be resized, minimum size constraints applied
2. Type commands in the input field at the bottom
4. View responses in the chat area above
- `todo Buy groceries` - Add a todo task
The GUI maintains all the functionality of the original console application while providing a modern, user-friendly interface.

* Indicates that this command should terminate the application.

* Abstract base class for all commands in the Rei application.
* Each command represents a specific action that can be performed on the task list.
* Executes the command with the provided task list, user interface, and storage.
* @param tasks the task list to operate on
* @param ui the user interface for displaying output
* @param storage the storage system for persisting tasks
* @throws ReiExceptions if there's an error executing the command
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, UiInterface ui, Storage storage)
* Checks if this command should terminate the application.
* @return true if this command should exit the application, false otherwise
* Command to create and add a new deadline task to the task list.
* A deadline task must be completed by a specific date and time.
* Constructs a new DeadlineCommand with the specified description and deadline.
* @param description the description of the deadline task
* @param ddl the deadline date and time when the task must be completed
* Executes the deadline command by creating a new deadline task and adding it to the task list.
* Also saves the updated task list to storage and displays confirmation to the user.
* @param tasks the TaskList to add the new deadline task to
* @param ui the Ui for displaying confirmation messages
* @param storage the Storage for persisting the updated task list
* @throws ReiExceptions if there's an error saving to storage
public void execute (TaskList tasks, UiInterface ui, Storage storage)
ui.show("Got it. I've added this task:");
ui.show("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Command to delete a task from the task list.
* Removes the specified task and saves the changes to storage.
* Constructs a new DeleteCommand with the specified task index.
* @param index the 0-based index of the task to delete
* Executes the delete command by removing the specified task from the task list.
* Also saves the updated task list to storage and displays confirmation to the user.
* @param tasks the TaskList containing the task to delete
* @param ui the Ui for displaying confirmation messages
* @param storage the Storage for persisting the updated task list
* @throws ReiExceptions if the task index is invalid or there's an error saving to storage
public void execute(TaskList tasks, UiInterface ui, Storage storage)
ui.show("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " task(s) in the list.");

public void execute(TaskList tasks, UiInterface ui, Storage storage) {

* Command to display all tasks in the task list.

* Updates the task's status and saves the changes to storage.

public void execute(TaskList tasks, UiInterface ui, Storage storage)
ui.show("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* Command to create and add a new todo task to the task list.
* A todo task is a simple task without any time constraints.
* Constructs a new TodoCommand with the specified task description.

* @param storage the Storage for persisting the updated task list
* @throws ReiExceptions if there's an error saving to storage
public void execute(TaskList tasks, UiInterface ui, Storage storage)
ui.show("Got it. I've added this task:");
ui.show("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");

* Abstract base class representing a task in the Rei application.
* All specific task types (Todo, Deadline, Event) extend this class.

* The task is initially marked as not done.
* @param description the description of the task
assert description != null : "Task description cannot be null";

* Gets the visual status icon for displaying the task completion status.
* @return "[X]" if the task is done, "[ ]" otherwise
* Gets the description of this task.
assert description != null : "Task description should never be null";
* Returns a string representation of this task for display purposes.
* @return a formatted string containing the status icon and description
* Returns a string representation of this task for file storage.
* @return a formatted string suitable for saving to file
* Represents a simple todo task without any time constraints.
* Extends the base Task class to provide todo-specific functionality.

* Returns a string representation of this todo task for display.
* @return a formatted string with [T] prefix, status icon, and description
* Returns a string representation of this todo task for file storage.
* @return a formatted string with T prefix for saving to file

This directory is where you can place your own avatar images for the chatbot interface.
## How to Add Your Own Images:
- **Size**: Any size (recommended 64x64 pixels, will be auto-resized to 40x40)
Put your PNG files in this folder:
-  **If images are found**: Your custom PNG images will be used as rectangular avatars (full image visible)
-  **If images are missing**: Attractive generated avatars will be used instead (blue gradient with person silhouette for user, green gradient with robot design for bot)
- Use clear, simple designs that work well in a 40x40 pixel rectangular format
- The full image will be displayed and stretched to fit the 40x40 pixel rectangle
- Images will have rounded corners for a polished look
- Good contrast against light backgrounds is recommended
- User: Profile photo, person silhouette, user icon
- Bot: Robot icon, AI symbol, chatbot mascot, "Rei" character design
**Note**: Images are displayed as rectangles with rounded corners, so the full image will be visible (no circular clipping).
assertTrue(task.isDone(), "Task should be marked as done");
assertFalse(task.isDone(), "Task should be marked as not done");
